intro: Alsine arabica, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a low-growing flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of tiny white or pink flowers. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, demonstrating its adaptability to harsh environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of desert flora.
